item.description:
Posted as a P-Collective FYI - Get Your Spring On!

Want to know a little more about what's going on in Urban Agriculture in PVD? Or maybe you'd just like to get some seeds for those tomatoes you always wanted to start? Then check this out! Of course it gives you a great excuse to go to Roger Williams Park too!


Saturday, March 2nd, 1-4 p.m. Roger Williams Park Botanical Center

Join Southside Community Land Trust and fellow gardeners on March 2nd for the 4th Annual Urban Agriculture Spring Kickoff! This event will be a food-growing "expo", featuring a seed swap, demonstrations and tables providing expert advice on seed starting, urban chicken keeping, beekeeping, composting and other food-growing topics.

This is a family-friendly event, and encourages gardeners of all ages to participate! There will be a Kids Corner for young gardeners, where they can enjoy crafts, games and other activities.

SCLT will be raffling off some fabulous prizes, including an SCLT Plant Sale gift certificate and membership combo and a tree start, courtesy of Groundwork Providence.

The Kickoff also marks the launch of the 2013 Plant Providence Calendar. Come get your full-color poster that displays the complete lineup of food-growing events and workshops going on throughout the year.

Admission to the event is FREE for members of the Providence Community Growers Network (PCGN) and $5 for nonmembers. All proceeds will support the PCGN and its mission to continue providing resources, educational workshops and community-building events to neighborhoods throughout Providence.

Leave the event with the tools, tips and enthusiasm that you will need to take on the upcoming growing season!
item.how_to_find_us: This is posted as an FYI (For Your Information) - I'm not sure I will be able to make this, but wanted you to know about it!
item.name: P-Collective FYI - 4th Annual Urban Agriculture Kickoff with SCLT!
